meanings.definition: of, relating to, or resembling phosphorus
meanings.sent1: The phosphoritic glow of the fireflies lit up the night.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the phosphoritic properties of the new element.
meanings.sent3: The phosphoritic paint on the walls made the room look like a magical forest.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was phosphoritic, lighting up the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The phosphoritic stars in the sky sparkled like diamonds.

meanings.sent1: The phosphoritic rocks in the cave emitted a faint glow.
meanings.sent2: The phosphoritic smell of the match filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The phosphoritic mushrooms in the forest seemed to glow in the dark.
meanings.sent4: His phosphoritic eyes shone with intelligence.
meanings.sent5: The phosphoritic liquid glowed eerily in the dark laboratory.

meanings.sent1: The geologist discovered a vein of phosphoritic in the mine.
meanings.sent2: The phosphoritic was used in the production of fertilizers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome claimed the phosphoritic was magical.
meanings.sent4: The phosphoritic sparkled in the sunlight like precious gems.
meanings.sent5: Miners dug deep to extract the valuable phosphoritic from the earth.
